form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Reed (for himself, Mr. Schumer, Mr. Menendez, Mr. Warner, Mr. Merkley, Ms. Warren, Mr. Blumenthal, Mr. Franken, Mr. Durbin, Mr. Kaine, and Ms. Hirono) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

form.official-title: To allow the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection to provide greater protection to servicemembers.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Military Consumer Protection Act.
Section 1002(12) of the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 (12 U.S.C. 5481(12)) is amendedâ€”

by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: sections 101, 107 (except with respect to bailments), 108 (except with respect to insurance), 201 (except with respect to child custody proceedings), 207, 301, 302, 303, 305, and 305A of the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act (50 U.S.C. App. 511, 517, 518, 521, 527, 531, 532, 533, 535, and 535a).
